title: Around the world people celebrate the new year | ABC NEWS
description: Around the world, people have welcomed in 2026 in a range of colourful and imaginative ways.  In Dubai, thousands queued for hours to watch a spectacular display including floating pianos and massive pyrotechnics. title: Swiss officials confirm dozens killed in ski resort fire | ABC NEWS
description: Dozens of people have died after an explosion and fire at a crowded bar in Crans-Montana in Switzerland, authorities have confirmed. Around 100 more are injured, many seriously, and multiple hospitals are treating victims. Authorities are not treating the incident as an attack. ABC Europe Correspondent Elias Clure shares the latest.  Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: Dozens killed and more injured in Swiss ski resort fire | ABC NEWS
description: Police in Switzerland say dozens of people have been killed and at least 100 injured after a fire broke out inside a bar during New Year's Eve celebrations. The blaze at the Crans-Montana resort started at around 1:30AM local time. Authorities are treating the incident as a fire and not an attack. A major emergency response is underway, with local media reporting hospitals are overwhelmed with burn victims. Elias Clure spoke to Manny Tsigas about the latest from the scene. title: Re-Spin: Mark Schwarzer on Australian football's past glories and future challenges
description: The Socceroos' 2005 World Cup qualifier win over Uruguay is arguably Australia's greatest sports moment. Mark Schwarzer was at the centre of it and has just been named to Sports Australia's Hall of Fame. The goalkeeper gives us some vivid recollections from his playing days before expanding on the challenges this generation is facing. The double-edged sword of the creation of the A-League, the changing face of the game and much more.  Featured: Mark Schwarzer, Socceroos legend.    Subscribe to the ABC Sport Newsletter (https://www.abc.net.au/connect)

title: Around 40 killed in Swiss ski resort bar fire on New Year’s Day | ABC NEWS
description: Around 40 people are feared dead and 115 are injured after a fire tore through a New Year's Eve party in the luxury Swiss ski resort town of Crans-Montana. Swiss President Guy Parmelin has described the blaze at Le Constellation bar as "one of the worst tragedies" the country has ever seen. title: Zohran Mamdani officially sworn in as New York City mayor | ABC NEWS
description: Zohran Mamdani has been officially sworn in as mayor of New York City. During a public swearing-in ceremony on the steps of City Hall, Mamdani vowed to govern expansively. The new mayor campaigned on a platform of democratic socialism in which he vowed to freeze rents and introduce subsidised childcare and free public buses. title: The Case of Kumanjayi Walker | The Case Of...
description: *Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders are advised a deceased person's name is used in this episode.* Kumanjayi Walker was a young Walpiri-Luritja man, shot by a police officer in the remote community of Yuendumu in 2019.  It was a confrontation that lasted seconds, but continues to reverberate today. His death caught the nation's attention, sparked a groundswell of activism, and ignited battles within politics and the police force. In The Case Of Kumanjayi Walker, Stephen Stockwell and reporter Melissa Mackay will retrace the murder trial and inquest that followed this death, and unpack the years-long impact.  The Case Of is the follow-up to the hit podcast Mushroom Case Daily, and all episodes of that show will remain available in the back catalogue of The Case Of.

title: Australian housing market shows first signs of easing since 2022 | ABC NEWS
description: The Australian housing market is showing signs of easing, after December recorded the smallest monthly increase in house prices in five months. It comes as the Sydney and Melbourne property markets fell by 0.1 per cent in the last month of 2025. title: Iran’s anti-government protests turn deadly as crackdown intensifies | ABC NEWS
description: Iranian protesters have rallied for a fifth day, angry about the country’s economy and alleged corruption and mismanagement from its government. The protests started among merchants angry about high inflation, but they've since been joined by university students and others unhappy about the regime. title: Could space factories be closer than we think? | ABC NEWS
description: A British company has successfully tested a factory in space that can build material for semiconductors – the building blocks essential to most electronics. Astrophysicist says conditions in space are conducive for manufacturing some materials, and with space launches becoming cheaper, orbital factories have a viable future. title: Millennium Falcon the last boat to finish Sydney to Hobart yacht race | ABC NEWS
description: Millennium Falcon has completed the 80th Sydney to Hobart yacht race as the final boat to cross the line after more than 141 hours at sea.  The 11.9-metre boat, with six people on board including skipper Robert Griffits, reached Hobart at 10:22am AEDT on New Year's Day.   Millennium Falcon was one of 94 of the original 128 starting entries to make it to the finish in Hobart. title: Swiss resort fire survivors say they were 'trapped' as Australian confirmed among injured | ABC NEWS
description: Authorities say "a large number of young people" are among the dozens killed and about 115 injured in a fire at the Swiss ski resort of Crans-Montana.   Flames engulfed the Le Constellation bar during a New Year's Eve party and survivors have claimed the blaze began because sparklers were being waved near the ceiling.    Federal minister Chris Bowen says one Australian is among the injured and is receiving medical care and that Australians concerned about family members can contact the Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade on 1300 555 135. title: Property prices plateau as interest rate shock approaches
description: Property prices rose nearly 13 per cent in 2025, but December sawan increase of just 0.7 per cent. Tim Lawless, head of Cotality, predicts interest rates will remain stable or increase as soon as February. He says that first-home owner subsidies are driving home value growth. At the same time, rents have surged 50 per cent over the past five years, and vacancy rates are nearing record lows. title: Usman Khawaja to retire from international cricket | ABC NEWS
description: Australia batter Usman Khawaja touched on the racial stereotypes he faced when he spoke to the media about his plans to retire after the fifth and final game of the Ashes series, marking his 88th Test.  Khawaja ends his Test career in the same place it began 15 years ago.  The SCG Ashes Test starts on Sunday, with Australia trying to finish off a victorious series with a fourth victory.
